channel.title: A on SSERL
channel.description: Recent content in A on SSERL

item.title: Jolan Philippe
item.description: Jolan Philippe obtained his Master’s degree at NAU in May 2019. His SSERL advisor was Frédéric Loulergue. He is now a PhD student at IMT Atlantique, Nantes, France.

item.title: Arvid Jakobsson
item.description: Arvid Jakobsson was a Phd student at the Université d’Orléans, France, and he is also working for Huawei Technologies France. His SSERL advisor was Frédéric Loulergue, and he was co-advised by Wadoud Bousdira and Frédéric Dabrowski at the Université d’Orléans, and Gaétan Hains and Wijnand Suijlen at Huawei Technologies France. His research is focused on the static analysis of scalable parallel programs.

item.title: Thibaut Tachon
item.description: Thibaut Tachon was a Phd student at the Université d’Orléans, France, and he was also working for Huawei Technologies France. His SSERL advisor was Frédéric Loulergue, and he was co-advised by Gaétan Hains at Huawei Technologies France. His research is focused on the bulk synchronous parallel automata formalism and a DSL for neural networks. He is now a research engineering at Huawei Technologies France.

item.title: Kevin Gonzalez Castro
item.description: Kevin Gonzalez Castro was an undergraduate research assistant at Northern Arizona University. He worked with Frédéric Loulergue on a domain specific language (DSL) for large-scale graph processing.
